metadata.title: CVE-2023-52522 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:fix possible store tearing in neigh_periodic_work() While looking at arelated syzbot report involving neigh_periodic_work(), I found that Iforgot to add an annotation when deleting an RCU protected item from alist. Readers use rcu_deference(*np), we need to use eitherrcu_assign_pointer() or WRITE_ONCE() on writer side to prevent storetearing. I use rcu_assign_pointer() to have lockdep support, this was thechoice made in neigh_flush_dev().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52522` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1056-azure-fde - 5.15.0-1056.64~20.04.1.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1092-fips - 5.4.0-1092.102
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-5.4.0-1092-fips - 5.4.0-1092.102
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1118-aws-fips - 5.4.0-1118.128+fips1
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-5.4.0-1118-aws-fips - 5.4.0-1118.128+fips1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1123-azure-fips - 5.4.0-1123.130+fips1
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-5.4.0-1123-azure-fips - 5.4.0-1123.130+fips1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1122-gcp-fips - 5.4.0-1122.131+fips1
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-5.4.0-1122-gcp-fips - 5.4.0-1122.131+fips1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
